page.title: 11ST.LAWRENCE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church stands on high ground overlooking the village of Frodsham, and is built entirely of local red sandstone. In 1986 it will celebrate its 900th Anniversary, having been recorded in the Domesday Book of 1086. The church tower contains eight bells. The treble has the highest note and the tenor, the heaviest bell, the lowest. A ten year old local schoolgirl writes, "My family has been ringing for four generations since 1900. I like bell ringing because it is an unusual hobby. We practice for 3 hours every Friday night. We ring for Sunday services, some weddings and funerals, for Royal occasions and to welcome in each New Year." The church is open to visitors three days each week.
